channel.title: Post your Machines Specs
channel.description:
I recently got a new machine to run as our house desktop, I'm curious what everyone else is running
Windows 7 64-bit 2x Xeon 1.6ghz Quad Core Processors 24 gb DDR3 1333 (Expandable to 196gb) 1x 60gb SSD (OS) 2x 60gb Standard Hard Drive (Misc Documents, and Program Files) 1x GeForce GTX 260 1000 Watt 80 Plus Power Supply

item.title: Post your Machines Specs
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

Intel i5 2500k @ 4.0GHZ (OC’d)
8GB Ripjaw (CBA the specs)
1TB Barracuda (nope, cba the specs.)
60GB Intel SSD (again cba the specs)
Gigabyte GTX 560Ti @ standard clocks. I’d rather not fry my GPU.
Corsair TX850.
Bought most parts off of Newegg with a little help from Speljohan

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Machines Specs
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:33, topic:448010”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=550900.msg4037929#msg4037929 date=1341351905]

Windows 7 64bit
3GB DDR2 RAM
450GB SATA Hard drive
nVIDIA GeForce 9600 GT (1GB)
AMD Athlon 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 5000+ (2.61GHz)

How does your computer handle runescape?

Mine is near exact to yours.
[/quote]Well I’m quite satisfied with the performance now, especially after the fps improvement update. I sometimes play in fullscreen with high settings and it’s beast.

Sorry for late reply.[/quote]

Then it’s the dual core. I’ve only an AMD Athlon (2.4GHz). That or the 64 bit OS but I don’t think that affects anything. Does it?

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Machines Specs
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Absolutely flawless for medium. Pretty much flawless for high too. I haven’t tried Ultra for BF3 yet but I’ll be picking it up soon for PC within the next couple of weeks.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Machines Specs
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:29, topic:448010”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=550900.msg4038923#msg4038923 date=1341423617]
Cost?
[/quote]

Around $1,400. Probably could have built it for a lot cheaper or something but I don’t mind, it’s exactly what I was looking for. I bought it through Malibal, and I have no worries if something happens to it. Their customer service is amazing. It’s a laptop by the way. I was going to go with a desktop but I switch between multiple houses often, so a desktop would have been inefficient.[/quote]

Feedback on playing games on medium settings?

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Machines Specs
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:14, topic:448010”][quote author=ghostly150 link=topic=550900.msg4037872#msg4037872 date=1341349501]
IBM ThinkPad T22
256mb RAM
~896Mhz CPU
~18GB HDD
8mb video card
S3 Graphics Savage/IX 1014
CrystalSound Funsion™

Anyway, its a pretty old laptop. However, I am looking into getting a new one. In the meantime I keep this one in excellent condition by defragging, disk cleaning up, and virus scanning all every single night.
[/quote]

The sad thing is this used to be able to run runescape no sweat. :([/quote]

I can run RuneScape on this thing… i set it to use 128mb ram and it works perfectly for me.
EDIT:
The default setting for the windows client is 256mb (my whole ram) and i changed it in the runescape.prm file to 128 and it doesnt hang so bad anymore

Read full topic
